stQueryHint Class Reference

#include <stQueryHint.h>

Public Member Functions

virtual ~stQueryHint ()
 
int GetHintType () const
 

Detailed Description

This class is the base class for all implementations of the query hint classes. A query hint is a special class that is used by some metric tree operations to store information about previous executions. This information can be used to enhance the performance of sucessive executions of the same operation.

Since each combination of operation/metric tree requires a specific type of information, each metric tree must implement its own set of query hint classes.

Users should not create instances of this class. Each tree has a method called stMetricTree::CreateQueryHint() which must be used to create the proper hint for each combination of mteric tree/query hint type.

For further information about this concept, see the library architecture documentation.

Author
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino.nosp@m.@icm.nosp@m.c.usp.nosp@m..br)
Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvie.nosp@m.ira@.nosp@m.icmc..nosp@m.usp..nosp@m.br)
Note
The implementation details of subclasses of this class are not relevant to users.

Member Function Documentation

int stQueryHint::GetHintType ( ) const
inline

Returns the hint type. The mean of this value must be specified by each metric access method.
